data.title: Campbellsville University named one of the Best Christian College of 2018
data.meta_description: By Josh Christian, student news writer, Office of University Communications CAMPBELLSVILLE, KY- Campbellsville University has recently been ranked 80 in the Top 100 of the Best Christian Colleges of 2018 […]
data.text:
By Josh Christian, student news writer, Office of University Communications

CAMPBELLSVILLE, KY- Campbellsville University has recently been ranked 80 in the Top 100 of the Best Christian Colleges of 2018 by College Consensus.

Campbellsville University achieved an average or above average score in six out of the seven categories listed by College Consensus, which they used to rank each university.

According to College Consensus, the percent of those admitted, the grand total number of students, the student-to-faculty ratio, the average grant aid awarded to undergraduate students by the federal, state, local or other institutions, the in-state and out-of-state tuition and fees were all categories in which Campbellsville University ranked average or above average.

The College Consensus ranking of Best Christian Colleges combines published rankings from various media outlets to determine the best Christ-centered schools.

“For Christian students who find that an education in a Christian setting fits their needs, the College Consensus Best Christian Colleges ranking gives direction and focus to search that could range near and far,” College Consensus said.

College Consensus, a unique new college review aggregator, is a comprehensive, composing a diverse survey including 97 different colleges and universities.

“It’s not just one voice stating an opinion—it’s many, many voices, computed objectively and equally,” according to the website of College Consensus.

“The College Consensus method allows every institution, the richest and the best-known university to the smallest and hardest-working regional college, to demonstrate what they do best.”

College Consensus continues:

“By combining the results of all of the most reputable college ranking publishers and thousands of real student reviews from around the web, College Consensus provides the most accurate and comprehensive ranking of a school’s reputation and quality available anywhere.”

Campbellsville University is a widely-acclaimed Kentucky-based Christian university with more than 10,000 students offering over 90 programs of study including 20 master’s degrees, six postgraduate areas and seven pre-professional programs. The university has off-campus centers in Kentucky cities Louisville, Harrodsburg, Somerset and Hodgenville with instructional sites in Elizabethtown, Owensboro, Summersville and Liberty, all in Kentucky, and one in Costa Mesa and the Silicon Valley in California, and a full complement of online programs. The website for complete information is campbellsville.edu.
